IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: The Eastern Music Festivals mission is to promote musical enrichment, excellence, professional collaboration, innovation and diversity through a nationally-recognized teaching program, music festival, concerts and other programs which will enhance the quality of life, health and vitality of our region.
IRS990.MissionDescription: The Eastern Music Festivals mission is to promote musical enrichment, excellence, professional collaboration, innovation and diversity through a nationally-recognized teaching program, music festival, concerts and other programs which will enhance the quality of life, health and vitality of our region.
IRS990.Description: SUCCESSFULLY OPERATED A FIVE WEEK SUMMER CLASSICAL SCHOOL OF MUSIC FOCUSED ON MUSICAL REFLECTION AND GROWTH FOR 172 YOUNG MUSICIANS FROM THE UNITED STATES AND OTHER COUNTRIES. THE SCHOOL IS CONDUCTED ANNUALLY AND BEGINS APPROXIMATELY THE LAST WEEK OF JUNE THROUGH THE END OF JULY. STUDENTS BOARD AT A LOCAL COLLEGE AND THE SCHOOL IS CONDUCTED AT THE LOCAL COLLEGE. STUDENTS PERFORM WITH FACULTY MUSICIANS WHILE TAKING CLASSES WITH THE FACULTY. THE STUDENTS PARTICIPATE IN THE MUSIC FESTIVAL. IN-KIND EXPENSES FOR ADVERTISING IN THE AMOUNT OF $102,909 ARE GENERATED.

Activity2.Description: SUCCESSFULLY OPERATED NATIONALLY RENOWNED SUMMER MUSIC FESTIVAL DURING A FIVE WEEK PERIOD IN THE SUMMER FOR THE TRIAD AND STATE OF NORTH CAROLINA COMMUNITY. THE SCHOOL CONDUCTS COMMUNITY OUTREACH CONCERTS -6, BONUS CONCERTS-4, MASTER CLASSES-9, RECITALS-2, FRINGE CONCERTS-15, LIFELONG LEARNING THROUGH EXPLORITAS-12, EASTERN FESTIVAL ORCHESTRA CONCERTS-5, YOUNG ARTISTS ORCHESTRA CONCERTS-9, FRIENDS AND GREAT PERFORMERS CONCERTS-5, UNCG CHAMBER MUSIC CONCERTS-5, CARNEGIE CHAMBER MUSIC CONCERTS-5, AND NUMEROUS OTHER OPPORTUNITIES FOR PUBLIC TO BE INVOLVED IN CLASSICAL AND FRINGE CONCERTS. IN-KIND EXPENSES FOR ADVERTISING IN THE AMOUNT OF $102,909 ARE GENERATED

ContractorCompensation.DescriptionOfServices: MUSIC DIRECTOR OF THE EASTERN MUSIC FEST

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION PURCHASES MUSIC SCORES AND RECEIVES GIFTS OF MUSIC SCORES THAT THE ORGANIZATION USES IN ITS MUSIC FESTIVAL AND SCHOOL TO FURTHER ITS MISSION.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: INTENDED USE IS TO DISTRIBUTE THE EARNINGS ON A 5% THREE YEAR ROLLING AVERAGE OF THE ENDOWMENT FUND TO FUND DESIGNATED SCHOLARSHIPS, FACULTY SALARIES, CONCERTMASTER CHAIR, FACULTY EXPENSES AND UNRESTRICTED EXPENSES.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: EMF is classified as a public charity and is exempt from income tax under Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code. Accordingly, no provision for income taxes is reflected in the accompanying financial statements. AS OF SEPTEMBER 30, 2010, MANAGEMENT BELIEVES THERE ARE NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS.

SCHEDULE D PART XII LINE 2D AND PART XIII LINE 2D. THE ORGANIZATION OPERATES A GIFT SHOP. THE EXPENSES IN THE AMOUNT OF $7,892 RELATED TO THE GIFT SHOP ARE RECORDED AS PART OF COSTS OF GOODS SOLD THEREFORE, THEY ARE NETTED AGAINST GIFT SHOP REVENUE. RECONCILING ITEM IS RECORDED ON PART XII LINE 2D AND PART XIII LINE 2D.

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: EASTERN MUSIC FESTIVAL INC PUBLISHES AN ANNUAL CATALOG THAT STATES THE SCHOOL'S NON-DISCRIMINATORY POLICY. THIS PUBLICATION IS DISTRIBUTED TO PROSPECTIVE APPLICANTS ANNUALLY.
IRS990ScheduleE.GovtFinancialAidExplanation: THE ORGANIZATIONS RECEIVED GRANT FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $10,000 FROM NATIONAL ENDOWMENT FOR THE ARTS TO FUND ITS FESTIVAL AND SCHOOL.

GrantsToIndOutsideUS.DescriptionOfNonCashAssistance: SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO THE STUDENTS TO OFFSET TUITION. THE STUDENT DOES NOT RECEIVE CASH
SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO THE STUDENTS TO OFFSET TUITION. THE STUDENT DOES NOT RECEIVE CASH
SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO THE STUDENTS TO OFFSET TUITION. THE STUDENT DOES NOT RECEIVE CASH
SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO THE STUDENTS TO OFFSET TUITION. THE STUDENT DOES NOT RECEIVE CASH

Form990ScheduleIPartIII.TypeOfGrant: SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS ATTENDING THE SCHOOL
Form990ScheduleIPartIII.DescriptionOfNonCashAssistance: NON CASH SCHOLARSHIP ASSISTANCE WAS A REDUCTION IN TUITION IN THE AMOUNT OF THE SCHOLARSHIP.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 2
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: MANY BOARD MEMBERS KNOW EACH OTHER AND HAVE AT ONE TIME OR ANOTHER ENGAGED IN A BUSINESS OR PERSONAL RELATIONSHIP IN THE COMMUNITY WITH EACH OTHER OUTSIDE OF THEIR RESPONSIBILITIES AS MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF EASTERN MUSIC FESTIVAL.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS IN THEIR MONTHLY MEETINGS. ANY BOARD MEMBERS WHO ARE NOT PRESENT, RECEIVE AN E-MAIL WITH A COPY OF THE 990 FOR THEIR REVIEW.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS SIGNED BY EVERY BOARD MEMBER EACH FISCAL YEAR.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE COMPENSATION FOR THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR WAS DELIBERATED BY THE INDEPENDENT BOARD OF DIRECTORS WITH CONSIDERATION TO COMPARABLE DATA OF OTHER NOT FOR PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. THE SUBSTANTIATION OF THE DELIBERATION AND DECISION IS DOCUMENTED IN BOARD MINUTES. ANNUAL REVIEW OF THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR IS COMPLETED WITH EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR'S COMMENTS INCLUDED.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: RECORD OF CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE KEPT ON HAND AT THE OFFICE OF THE ORGANIZATION AND THE ORGANIZATION MAKES THEM AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: COMMITTEE OVERSIGHT FOR AUDIT OF FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR ITS COMMITTEE OVERSIGHT FOR THE AUDIT OF THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
